Replay
Photographs Question-Response Conversations Talks Incomplete Sentences Text Completion Reading Comprehension
Image Description Q&A Dialogue Presentations Sentence Completion Paragraph Completion Reading
You will hear four descriptions of a picture. Choose the sentence that best describes what you see. The question and choices are not printed and are read only once. You will hear a question followed by three responses. Choose the most appropriate response. The audio is played only once and is not printed. You will hear several conversations between two or three people. Then answer the questions based on what you hear. Questions and answer choices are printed. You will hear short talks given by a speaker. Then answer the questions based on the talk. Questions and answer choices are printed. You will see a sentence with a blank. Below are four words or phrases labeled A, B, C, D. Choose the one that best completes the sentence. You will see four short texts with some blanks. Each blank has four answer choices. Choose the best word or sentence to complete the text. You will read various texts such as emails, letters, announcements, articles, and ads. Then answer questions based on what you read.
6 questions, each with 4 options A, B, C, D. You will see a photo and hear 4 sentences, choose the most accurate description. 25 questions with 3 options A, B, C. Listen to the question, then the responses, and choose the best one. 13 conversations, each with 3 questions (39 total). Each question has 4 options A, B, C, D. Some may include visuals or tables. 10 talks, each with 3 questions (30 total). Talks may include announcements, ads, news, instructions, or presentations. 40 independent questions. Each sentence has a blank and 4 options. Tests grammar, vocabulary, and usage in context. 4 texts, each with 4 blanks (16 total). You may fill in words, phrases, or complete sentences. Single passages (29 questions): 10 texts with 2–4 questions each. Double passages (25 questions): 5 sets with 5 questions each.
Focus on the details in the image such as people, objects, actions, and positions. Eliminate answers with similar-sounding words but different meanings. Pay attention to the question word (What, Where, When, Why, How). Avoid answers with similar sounds but unrelated meaning. Read the questions first to know what to listen for. Pay attention to context, speakers, time, place, and purpose. Read the questions beforehand. Focus on purpose, audience, time, location, and specific details mentioned. Read the entire sentence before choosing. Pay attention to grammar, word type, verb tense, and meaning. Read the whole passage to understand the context. Pay attention to sentence connections and logical flow. Read the questions before reading the text. Find keywords in the question and locate them in the text. Focus on details and logical inference.
~30 seconds ~25 seconds ~1 minute ~45 seconds ~1.5 minutes
